comment: VAERS is what we have, though problems are way underreported. They should be following up thoroughly, not telling people adverse reactions are a good sign, and telling people that deaths and clotting issues are a coincidence. Wishy washy data is poor scientific method.

                                    :mod (a2 / adverse))
                              :ARG1 (g / good-02))

comment: Exactly!I had participated in a clinical trial of a drug, and I was followed closely for a year. As far as I know, no one is being followed any more in this trial. Where is their data coming from?

comment: Ive worked in clinical research and I have wondered the same thing. Like how are you capturing adverse events or outcomes? My son didnt even get a flier with info about the vaccine or who to call with problems.
